author: Pablo Valerio
description:
Broadcom canceled its $1 billion ATP facility in Spain this month, showing the opportunistic project wasn't central to its global strategy.

The post Broadcom Cancels Spain Fab, Impacting Europe Semiconductor Ambitions appeared first on EE Times.
title: Broadcom Cancels Spain Fab, Impacting Europe Semiconductor Ambitions

author: KIOXIA
description:
Discover KIOXIA's Yokkaichi Plant, a cutting-edge smart factory powered by AI and three billion data points, driving innovation in flash memory.

The post A massive, constantly evolving smart factory powered by three billion data points and AI: The Yokkaichi Plant of KIOXIA is at the forefront of flash memory innovation. appeared first on EE Times.
title: A massive, constantly evolving smart factory powered by three billion data points and AI: The Yokkaichi Plant of KIOXIA is at the forefront of flash memory innovation.

author: NI - now part of Emerson
description:
Evolution of 5G toward 6G  As 5G deployments gain traction and infrastructure providers roll out new capabilities, the research community is starting to look beyond 5G. 6G is coming and could involve covering much higher frequencies (into the THz bands), phased-array antenna solutions, and increasing bandwidths and modulation densities. We can also expect to see […]

The post Research 6G Technologies with USRPs & OpenAirInterface (OAI) Software appeared first on EE Times.
title: Research 6G Technologies with USRPs & OpenAirInterface (OAI) Software

author: Steve Xu, Co-Founder and Chief Architect, XgenSilicon
description:
An ASIC approach enables to achieve a hardware-efficient implementation of LLMs through custom design, resulting in lower power and cost.

The post Why ASIC Design Makes Sense for LLM-On-Device appeared first on EE Times.
title: Why ASIC Design Makes Sense for LLM-On-Device
